arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا وَمَا نَحْنُ لَهُۥ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: “He	is	just	a	man	who	has	fabricated	a	lie	against	Allah,	and	we	are	not	going	to	believe	him.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	nahiñ	magar	ek	mard	jisne	Allah	par	jhoot	bāñdhā	aur	ham	usey	Mān	ne	Ke	nahiñ

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“My	Lord!	Help	me	as	they	deny	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Arz	ki	ke	:	Aye	mere	Rab!	Meri	Madad	farmā	is	par	ke	unhoñ	ne	mujhe	jhutlāyā,

arabicText: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٍۢ لَّيُصْبِحُنَّ نَـٰدِمِينَ
englishTranslationText: Said	Allah,	“They	will	soon	wake	up	at	morn,	regretting.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Allah	ne	farmāyā	ke:	kuchh	der	jāti	hai	ke	yeh	subah	kareñge	pachtāte	huye

arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ غُثَآءًۭ ۚ فَبُعْدًۭا لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	true	Scream	seized	them	-	We	therefore	made	them	like	rotten	hay;	so	away	with	the	
unjust	people!
romanUrduTranslationText: .To	unheiñ	āa	liyā	Sacchi	chinghād	ne	to	hamne	unheiñ	ghās	koodā	kardiyā	to	door	hoñ	ƶālim	log

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ قُرُونًا ءَاخَرِينَ
englishTranslationText: Then	after	them,	We	created	other	generations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	unke	b’ād	hamne	aur	sangateiñ	(Qaumeiñ)	paidā	keiñ

arabicText: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
No	nation	can	go	before	its	term	ends	nor	
stay	back.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koi	Ummat	apni	me’ād	se	na	pehle	jāye	na	
peechhe	rahe

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتْرَا ۖ كُلَّ مَا جَآءَ أُمَّةًۭ رَّسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُ ۚ فَأَتْبَعْنَا بَعْضَهُم بَعْضًۭا وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ ۚ فَبُعْدًۭا لِّقَوْمٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	then	sent	our	Noble	Messengers,	one	
after	another;	whenever	a	nation’s	Noble	
Messenger	came	to	it	they	denied	him,	We	
therefore	united	the	succeeding	with	the	
old,	and	made	them	history;	so	far	removed	
be	the	people	who	do	not	believe!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Hamne	Apne	Rasool	bheje	ek	peechhe	
doosrā	jab	kisi	Ummat	ke	pās	uskā	Rasool	
āayā	unhoñ	ne	usey	jhutlāyā	to	hamne	
agloñ	se	pichhle	milā	diye	aur	unheiñ	
kahāniyāñ	kar	dālā	to	door	ho	woh	log	ke	
Imān	nahiñ	lāte.

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
We	then	sent	Moosa	and	his	brother	
Haroon,	with	Our	signs	and	a	clear	proof.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Phir	Hamne	Musā	aur	uske	bhāi	Hāroon	ko	
apni	Āyatoñ	aur	raushan	sanad	ke	sāth	
bhejā

arabicText: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا عَالِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Towards	Firaun	and	his	court	members	–	
in	response	they	were	haughty,	and	they	
were	in	dominance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Fir’aun	aur	uske	darbāriyoñ	ki	taraf	to	
unhoñ	ne	guroor	kiya	aur	woh	log	galba	
pāye	huye	the

arabicText: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَـٰبِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	therefore	said,	“Shall	we	believe	in	
two	humans	like	ourselves,	whereas	their	
nation	is	servile	to	us?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	bole	kya	ham	Imān	le	āayeiñ	apne	jaise	
do	ādmiyoñ	par?	Aur	unki	Qaom	hamāri	
bandagi	kar	rahi	hai

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُهْلَكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	they	denied	them	–	therefore	became	
of	those	who	were	destroyed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	un	Dono	ko	Jhutlāyā	to	halāk	
kiye	huoñ	meiñ	hogaye

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	gave	Moosa	the	Book,	that	
they	may	attain	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	Hamne	Mūsā	ko	Kitāb	‘aṭa	
farmāyi	ke	unko	hidāyat	ho

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُۥٓ ءَايَةًۭ وَءَاوَيْنَـٰهُمَآ إِلَىٰ رَبْوَةٍۢ ذَاتِ قَرَارٍۢ وَمَعِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	the	son	of	Maryam	(Prophet	
Eisa)	and	his	mother	a	sign,	and	We	gave	
them	shelter	on	a	height,	a	place	to	stay	
and	visible	springs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	Mariyam	aur	uske	bete	ko	
nishāni	kiya	aur	unheiñ	thikānā	diyā	ek	
buland	zameen	jahañ	basne	ka	maqām	Aur	
nigāh	ke	sāmne	bahtā	pāni

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلرُّسُلُ كُلُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَٱعْمَلُوا۟ صَـٰلِحًا ۖ إِنِّى بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“O	Noble	Messengers,	eat	good	clean	
things,	and	do	good	deeds;	I	know	all	that	
you	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aye	Paighambaroñ	pākeeza	cheezeiñ	khāo	
aur	achchha	kām	karo	maiñ	tumhāre	
kāmoñ	ko	jānta	huñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱتَّقُونِ
englishTranslationText: “And	indeed	this	religion	of	yours	is	one	religion	only	and	I	am	your	Lord,	therefore	fear	Me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	yeh	tumhārā	Deen	ek	hi	deen	hai	aur	maiñ	tumhārā	Rab	huñ	to	Mujh	se	daro	.

arabicText: فَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًۭا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍۭ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
englishTranslationText: But	their	nations	broke	their	tasks	into	pieces;	every	group	happy	with	what	it	has.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	unki	Ummatoñ	ne	apnā	kām	āpas	meiñ	tukde-tukde	karliyā	har	giroh	jo	uske	pās	hai	uspar	
khush	hai

arabicText: فَذَرْهُمْ فِى غَمْرَتِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
englishTranslationText: So	leave	them	in	their	intoxication	till	a	time.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	unko	chhodh	do	unke	nashe	meiñ	ek	waqt	tak

arabicText: أَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُم بِهِۦ مِن مَّالٍۢ وَبَنِينَ
englishTranslationText: Do	they	assume	that	the	wealth	and	sons	which	We	provide	them	-
romanUrduTranslationText: .Kyā	yeh	khayāl	kar	raheiñ	haiñ	ke	woh	jo	ham	unki	madad	kar	rahe	haiñ	māl	aur	betoñ	se

arabicText: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ ۚ بَل لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: :	Are	quickly	giving	them	goodness?	In	fact,	they	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh	jald	Jald	unko	bhalāyiyāñ	dete	haiñ	balke	unheiñ	khabar	nahiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ خَشْيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	those	who	are	overwhelmed	due	to	the	fear	of	their	Lord
romanUrduTranslationText: .Beshak	woh	jo	apne	Rab	ke	dar	se	sahme	huye		haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	those	who	believe	in	the	signs	of	their	Lord	-
romanUrduTranslationText: .Aur	woh	jo	apne	Rab	ki	āyatoñ	par	Imān	lāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِرَبِّهِمْ لَا يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	those	who	do	not	ascribe	any	partner	to	their	Lord	-
romanUrduTranslationText: .Aur	woh	jo	apne	Rab	ka	koi	shareek	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْتُونَ مَآ ءَاتَوا۟ وَّقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ رَٰجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	give	what	they	give	and	their	
hearts	fear	for	they	have	to	return	to	their	
Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	woh	jo	dete	haiñ	jo	kuchh	deiñ	aur	unke	
dil	dar	rahe	haiñ	yuñ	ke	unko	apne	Rab	ki	
taraf	phirnā	hai

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَهُمْ لَهَا سَـٰبِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
These	people	hasten	to	perform	goodness,	
and	it	is	they	who	shall	reach	it	first.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	log	bhalāiyoñ	meiñ	jaldi	karte	haiñ	aur	
yehi	sabse	Pehle	unheiñ	pahuñche

arabicText: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَلَدَيْنَا كِتَـٰبٌۭ يَنطِقُ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	do	not	burden	any	soul	beyond	its	
capacity,	and	with	Us	is	a	Book	*	that	speaks	
the	truth,	and	they	will	not	be	wronged.	(*	
The	preserved	tablet	or	the	record	of	one’s	
deeds.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	kisi	jān	par	bojh	nahiñ	rakhte	magar	
uski	tāqat		bhar	aur	Hamāre	pās	ek	Kitāb	hai	
ke	Haq	bolti	hai	aur	unpar	ƶulm	na	hogā

arabicText: بَلْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍۢ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلٌۭ مِّن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمْ لَهَا عَـٰمِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	contrary,	their	hearts	are	in	neglect	
of	this	and	their	works	are	different	than	
those	of	the	believers,	the	works	that	they	
are	doing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	unke	dil	us	se	gaflat	meiñ	hai	aur	Unke	
kām	un	kāmoñ	se	judā	haiñ	jinheiñ	woh	kar	
raheiñ	haiñ

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِم بِٱلْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْـَٔرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
To	the	extent	that	when	We	seized	the	
wealthy	among	them	with	punishment,	they	
immediately	began	imploring.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	Hamne	unke	ameeroñ	ko	
‘aƶāb	meiñ	pakdā	to	jabhi	woh	faryād	karne	
lage

arabicText: لَا تَجْـَٔرُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّكُم مِّنَّا لَا تُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Do	not	implore	this	day;	you	will	not	be	
helped	by	Us.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āaj	faryād	na	karo	hamāri	taraf	se	tumhāri	
madad	na	Hogi	.

arabicText: قَدْ كَانَتْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْقَـٰبِكُمْ تَنكِصُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“My	verses	were	recited	to	you,	so	you	used	
to	turn	back	on	your	heels.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Beshak	Meri	Āyateiñ	tum	par	padhi	jāti	thiñ	
to	tum	Apni	ediyoñ	ke	bal	ulte	Palat-te	the

arabicText: مُسْتَكْبِرِينَ بِهِۦ سَـٰمِرًۭا تَهْجُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Priding	yourself	in	serving	the	Sacred	
Masjid;	at	night	you	utter	indecent	stories	in	
it,	while	discarding	the	truth.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Khidmat-e-Haram	par	badāyi	mārte	ho,	rāt	
ko	wahāñ	be-hooda	kahāniyāñ	bakte

arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَدَّبَّرُوا۟ ٱلْقَوْلَ أَمْ جَآءَهُم مَّا لَمْ يَأْتِ ءَابَآءَهُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	pondered	the	matter,	or	did	
that	come	to	them,	which	did	not	come	to	
their	forefathers?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Haq	ko	chhode	huye	kya	unhoñ	ne	bāt	ko	
soñchā	nahiñ	yā	unke	pās	woh	āyā	jo	Unke	
bāp	dādā	ke	pās	na	āyā	thā

arabicText: أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِفُوا۟ رَسُولَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	is	it	that	they	did	not	recognise	their	
Noble	Messenger,	therefore	they	consider	him	alien?
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Yā	unhoñ	ne	apne	Rasool	ko	na	pehchānā	to	
woh	usey	be-gāna	samjh	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۢ ۚ بَلْ جَآءَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	they	say,	“He	is	afflicted	by	a	demon”;	in	fact	he	brought	the	Truth	to	them,	and	most	of	them	
dislike	the	Truth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	kehte	haiñ	usey	saudā	(Diwāna	Pan)	hai	
balke	woh	to	Unke	pās	Haq	laye	aur	un	meiñ	
aksar	ko	Haq	burā	lagtā	hai

arabicText: وَلَوِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْحَقُّ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ لَفَسَدَتِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّ ۚ بَلْ أَتَيْنَـٰهُم بِذِكْرِهِمْ فَهُمْ عَن ذِكْرِهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	the	Truth	followed	their	desires,	then	indeed	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	those	who	
are	in	them	would	be	destroyed;	in	fact	We	brought	to	them	a	thing	in	which	lay	their	repute,	so	they	
are	turned	away	from	their	own	repute.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	agar	Haq	unki	khwāhishoñ	ki	pairwi	kartā	to	zaroor	āasmān	aur	zameen	aur	jo	koi	in	meiñ	haiñ	
sab	tabāh	hojate	balke	ham	to	unke	pās	woh	cheez	laye	jis	meiñ	unki	nāmwari	thi	to	woh	apni	‘izzat	
se	hi	muñh	phere	huye		haiñ.

arabicText: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ خَرْجًۭا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌۭ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	ask	any	fee	from	them?	So	the	
reward	of	your	Lord	is	the	best;	and	He	is	the	Best	Provider	of	Sustenance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	un	se	kuchh	ujrat	māñgte	ho,	to	tumhāre	Rab	ka	ajar	sabse	bhalā	aur	wo	sabse	behtar	Rozi	
dene	wāla.

arabicText: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	you	call	them	to	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	tum	unheiñ	seedhi	rāh	ki	taraf	bulāte	ho

arabicText: وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ عَنِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ لَنَـٰكِبُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	those	who	do	not	believe	in	the	Hereafter	are	deviated	from	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	jo	āakhirat	par	Imān	nahiñ	lāte	zaroor	seedhi	rāh	se	katrāye	huye	haiñ.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَوْ رَحِمْنَـٰهُمْ وَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِم مِّن ضُرٍّۢ لَّلَجُّوا۟ فِى طُغْيَـٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	have	mercy	upon	them	and	
remove	the	calamity	which	has	befallen	
them,	they	would	still	stubbornly	persist,	
wandering	in	their	rebellion.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Ham	unpar	Rahem		kareiñ	aur	jo	
musibat	unpar	padi	hai	tāl	deiñ	to	zaroor	
bhat	panā	(Ehsān	farāmoshi)	kareiñ	ge	
Apni	sarkashi	meiñ	bahekte	huye		.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْعَذَابِ فَمَا ٱسْتَكَانُوا۟ لِرَبِّهِمْ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	grasped	them	with	
punishment,	so	neither	did	they	submit	
themselves	to	their	Lord,	nor	do	they	cry	
humbly.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	unheiñ	ázāb	meiñ	
pakdā	to	na	woh	apne	Rab	ke	huzoor	meiñ	
jhuke	aur	na	gid-gidāte	haiñ	.

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًۭا ذَا عَذَابٍۢ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
englishTranslationText:
To	the	extent	that	when	We	opened	the	
gate	of	a	severe	punishment	for	them,	
they	thereupon	lie	despairingly	in	it.		.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	Hamne	unpar	kholā	kisi	
sakht	ázāb	ka	darwāzah	to	ab	woh	is	meiñ	
na	ummed	pade	haiñ

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	has	created	ears	and	
eyes	and	hearts	for	you;	very	little	is	the	
right	you	acknowledge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Wohi	hai	jis	ne	banāye	tumhāre	liye	
kān	aur	āankheiñ	aur	dil	tum	bahut	hi	kam	
Haq	mānte	ho	.

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	has	spread	you	in	the	
earth,	and	towards	Him	you	are	to	be	
raised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Wohi	hai	jisne	tumheiñ	zameen	meiñ	
phailāyā	aur	usi	ki	taraf	uthnā	hai

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ ٱخْتِلَـٰفُ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	gives	life	and	causes	
death,	and	for	Him	are	the	alternations	of	
night	and	day;	so	do	you	not	have	sense?
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	Wohi	jilāye	aur	māre	aur	usi	ke	liye	hai	
rāt	aur	din	ki	tabdeeleiñ	to	kya	tumheiñ	
samjh	nahiñ

arabicText: بَلْ قَالُوا۟ مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	contrary,	they	said	the	same	as	
what	the	former	people	used	to	say.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Balke	unhoñ	ne	wohi	kahi	Jo	agle	Kehte	
the.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًۭا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	say,	“Will	we,	when	we	die	and	turn	
into	dust	and	bones,	be	raised	again?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	kya	jab	ham	mar	jāyeiñ	aur	mit-ti	aur	
had-diyāñ	ho	jayeiñ	kya	phir	nikāleiñ	jayeiñ	ge

arabicText: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا هَـٰذَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	this	promise	was	given	to	us	and	before	us	to	our	forefathers	–	this	is	nothing	but	
stories	of	earlier	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Beshak	yeh	w’āda	hamko	aur	hamse	pehle	hamāre	bāp	dādā	ko	diyā	gayā	yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	
wohi	agli	dāstāneiñ	.

arabicText: قُل لِّمَنِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهَآ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“To	Whom	does	the	earth	and	
all	that	is	in	it	belong	to,	if	you	know?”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Tum	farmāo	kiskā	māl	hai	zameen	aur	jo	kuchh	is	meiñ	hai	agar	tum	jānte	ho?

arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Thereupon	they	will	say,	“To	Allah”;	proclaim,	“Therefore	why	do	you	not	ponder?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	kaheiñ	ge	ke	Allah	ka	tum	farmāo	phir	kyuñ	nahiñ	sochte?

arabicText: قُلْ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ ٱلسَّبْعِ وَرَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Say,	“Who	is	the	Lord	of	the	seven	heavens,	and	the	Lord	of	the	Tremendous	Throne?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	kaun	hai	Mālik	sātoñ	āsmānoñ	ka	aur	Mālik	bade	Arsh	ka?

arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: Thereupon	they	will	say,	“Such	greatness	is	only	that	of	Allah”;	say,	“So	why	do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	kaheiñ	ge	yeh	Allah	hi	ki	shān	hai,	tum	farmāo	phir	kyuñ	nahiñ	darte?

arabicText: قُلْ مَنۢ بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيْهِ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“In	Whose	hand	is	the	control	over	all	things,	and	He	provides	refuge,	and	none	can	provide	
refuge	against	Him,	if	you	know?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Tum	farmāo	kiske	hāth	hai	har	cheez	ka	qābu?	Aur	woh	panāh	detā	hai	uske	khilāf	koi	panāh	
nahiñ	de	saktā	agar	tumheiñ	‘ilm	ho.

arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسْحَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Thereupon	they	will	say,	“Such	greatness	is	only	that	of	Allah”;	say,	“Then	by	what	magic	are	
you	deceived?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	kaheiñ	ge	yeh	Allah	hi	ki	shān	hai,	tum	farmāo	phir	kis	jādu	ke	fareb	meiñ	pade	ho?

arabicText: بَلْ أَتَيْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	fact	We	brought	the	Truth	to	them,	and	
indeed	they	are	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	Ham	unke	pās	Haq	laye	aur	woh	be
shak	jhute	haiñ

arabicText: مَا ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍۢ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُۥ مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ ۚ إِذًۭا لَّذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَـٰهٍۭ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	has	not	chosen	any	child,	nor	any	
other	God	along	with	Him	–	were	it	so,	
each	God	would	have	taken	away	its	
creation,	and	each	one	would	certainly	
wish	superiority	over	the	other;	Purity	is	
to	Allah	above	all	the	matters	they	
fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Allah	ne	koi	bachcha	ikhtiyār	na	kiya	aur	
na	uske	sāth	koi	doosrā	khudā	yuñ	hotā	to	
har	khudā	apni	makhlooq	le	jātā	aur	
zaroor	ek	doosre	par	apni	t’alli	(Badāi)	
chāhtā,	pāki	hai	Allah	ko	un	bātoñ	se	jo	yeh	
banāte	haiñ

arabicText: عَـٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ فَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	All	Knowing,	of	every	hidden	and	the	
visible	–	so	Supremacy	is	to	Him	over	
their	ascribing	of	partners	(to	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jān-ne	wāla	har	nehāñ	wa	‘eyāñ	(Poshidah	
wa	Zahir)	ka	to	Usey	bulandi	hai	unke	
shirk	se

arabicText: قُل رَّبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّى مَا يُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Pray,	“My	Lord!	If	You	show	me	the	
promise	they	are	given,”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	‘arz	karo	ke	aye	mere	Rab!	Agar	tu	
mujhe	dikhāye

arabicText: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِى فِى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	my	Lord,	do	not	group	me	
with	the	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Jo	unheiñ	w’āda	diyā	jātā	hai	to	aye	mere	
Rab	mujhe	un	ƶālimoñ	ke	sāth	na	karnā

arabicText: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمْ لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	are	Able	to	show	you	the	
promise	they	are	given.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	be-shak	Ham	Qādir	haiñ	ke	tumheiñ	
dikhā	deiñ	jo	unheiñ	w’āda	de	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: ٱدْفَعْ بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَ ۚ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Repel	evil	with	the	best	deeds;	We	well	
know	the	matters	that	they	fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Sabse	achchhi	bhalāyi	se	burāyi	ko	daf	‘a	
karo	Ham	khoob	jānte	haiñ	jo	bāteiñ	yeh	
banāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَٰتِ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينِ
englishTranslationText:
And	submit,	“My	Lord!	I	seek	Your	refuge	
from	the	instigation	of	the	devils.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	tum	‘arz	karo	ke	aye	mere	Rab!	Teri	
panāh	Shayāteen	ke	was-wasoñ	se

arabicText: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَن يَحْضُرُونِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	my	Lord,	(I	seek)	Your	refuge	from	
their	coming	to	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	aye	mere	Rab!	Teri	panāh	ke	woh	
mere	pās	āayeñ

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ٱرْجِعُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Until,	when	death	comes	to	one*	of	them,	
he	says,	“O	my	Lord,	send	me	back!”	(The	
disbelievers)
romanUrduTranslationText: Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	maut	āye	to	kehtā	hai	ke	aye	mere	Rab!	Mujhe	wāpas	pher	dijiye

arabicText: لَعَلِّىٓ أَعْمَلُ صَـٰلِحًۭا فِيمَا تَرَكْتُ ۚ كَلَّآ ۚ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَآئِلُهَا ۖ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِم بَرْزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Perhaps	I	may	do	some	good	deeds	in	what	I	have	left	behind”;	this	is	just	a	word	that	he	utters	
from	his	mouth;	and	confronting	them	is	a	barrier	until	the	day	in	which	they	will	be	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Shāyad	ab	maiñ	kuchh	bhalāyi	kamāoñ	us	meiñ	jo	chod	āayā	huñ	hisht	(Hargiz	Nahi)	yeh	to	ek	
bāt	hai	jo	woh	apne	muñh	se	kahtā	hai	aur	unke	āage	ek	ādh	hai	us	din	tak	jis	meiñ	uthāye	jāyeiñ	
ge

arabicText: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَلَآ أَنسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ وَلَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	Trumpet	is	blown	-	so	there	will	neither	be	any	relationship	among	them	*	that	
day,	nor	will	they	ask	about	one	another.	(The	disbelievers)
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jab	Soor	phuñkā	jāyegā	to	na	un	meiñ	Rishte	raheiñ	ge	aur	na	ek	doosre	ki	bāt	pooñche	.

arabicText: فَمَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	the	ones	whose	scales	prove	heavy	-	they	are	the	successful.
romanUrduTranslationText: .To	jinki	touleiñ	bhāri	hoyiñ	wohi	murād	ko	pahuñche

arabicText: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فِى جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	ones	whose	scales	prove	light	–	it	is	they	who	put	their	lives	into	ruin,	remaining	in	hell	
forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinki	touleiñ	halki	padiñ	wohi	haiñ	jinhoñ	ne	apni	jāneiñ	ghāte	meiñ	dāliñ	hamesha	dozakh	
meiñ	raheiñ	ge	.

arabicText: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَـٰلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText: The	fire	shall	scorch	their	faces,	and	they	will	remain	dejected	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Unke	muñh	par	āag	lapat	māre	gi	aur	woh	us	meiñ	muñh	chadāye	hoñge

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Were	not	My	verses	recited	to	you,	so	
you	used	to	deny	them?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	par	meri	Āayateñ	na	padhi	jāti	
theiñ	to	tum	unheiñ	jhulāte	the

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًۭا ضَآلِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	say,	“Our	Lord!	Our	ill-fate	
overcame	us,	and	we	were	the	astray	
people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Kaheiñ	ge	aye	Rab	hamāre	ham	par	hamāri	
bad-bakhti	gālib	āayi	aur	ham	gumrāh	log	
the	.

arabicText: رَبَّنَآ أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Our	Lord,	remove	us	from	hell	–	then	if	
we	do	the	same,	we	are	the	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aye	Rab	hamāre	hamko	dozakh	se	nikāl	de	
phir	agar	ham	waise	hi	kareiñ	to	ham	zālim	
haiñ
